concord_system.description: CONCORD is the interstellar police force of New Eden. They enforce security in high-sec space and respond to criminal acts. In EVE OFFLINE, CONCORD provides security enforcement for PVE gameplay.

high_sec.description: Empire-controlled space with CONCORD protection. Criminal acts result in swift CONCORD response.

low_sec.description: Frontier space with limited security. Gate guns fire on criminals but CONCORD does not respond.

null_sec.description: Lawless space with no security enforcement. Only player-created structures provide safety.

suspect.description: Flagged for minor infractions. Anyone may engage you without penalty.

criminal.description: Flagged for criminal acts. CONCORD will respond and destroy your ship in high-sec.

weapons_timer.description: Active when you have recently used aggressive modules. Cannot dock or jump while active.

security_status.description: Your personal security status ranges from -10.0 to +10.0. Low security status restricts access to high-sec space.

effects.above_0: Full access to all empire space.
effects.-0.1_to_-1.9: Faction police may engage you in the corresponding faction's high-sec space.
effects.-2.0_to_-4.9: Cannot enter 1.0 security systems without being attacked by faction police.
effects.-5.0_and_below: Kill on sight in all high-sec space. CONCORD and faction police will engage.

gaining_security_status.killing_npc_pirates: Small security status gain per kill, scaled by NPC bounty value.
gaining_security_status.completing_missions: Security status gain from completing agent missions.

insurance_system.description: Ships can be insured against destruction. When an insured ship is destroyed, you receive an ISK payout based on the insurance level.

basic.name: Basic Insurance
basic.description: Default insurance on all ships. Pays 40% of base ship value on destruction.

standard.name: Standard Insurance
standard.description: Pays 50% of base ship value on destruction.

bronze.name: Bronze Insurance
bronze.description: Pays 60% of base ship value on destruction.

silver.name: Silver Insurance
silver.description: Pays 70% of base ship value on destruction.

gold.name: Gold Insurance
gold.description: Pays 80% of base ship value on destruction.

platinum.name: Platinum Insurance
platinum.description: Full payout. Pays 100% of base ship value on destruction.

notes: Insurance only covers the hull value, not fitted modules or cargo.
Tech II and faction ships receive lower insurance payouts relative to their market value.
Insurance is voided if the ship is repackaged.
Only one insurance contract per ship at a time.
